column4: I don't know what I did to my GPG signatures, but whenever I try to reload to check for updated packages, or when I add new package sources and reload for them, I get a GPG error: http://mirrors.cavecreek.net maverick Release: The following signatures were invalid: NODATA 1 NODATA 2GPG as well as six or eight other GPG errors.
in synaptic it gives me those errors via gui, in terminal it just says there's errors you may need to update your..
how do I fix that though? it didn't happen until after I added a more learning focused Ubuntu tweaker.
Didn't actually change any of the gpgs or software sources other then adding to.
Hate when I screw things up.
have you tried disabling all the ppa's or whatever? Maybe if you write them down and re-add them, things will be ok
you know how easy it is for those to screw up your GPG signatures?
he was talking to someone else
'Software Sources' under Administration
oops, or in Synaptic Package Manager
in Synaptic, it's Settings -> Repositories
Other
you might also check under "Authentication" to see if it has any keys duped
then I have no idea what it's talking about when it says you have dupes :P
it's cause you're testing the limits of what you can do, it's not such a bad thing
my theory about linux is if you don't screw up the system at least twice a week, you're doing something wrong
hey, how's it going? not so well I take it?
hey, that doesn't sound too bad!
yeah, it's pretty tough to get around that one, but it actually is possible to update kernel without rebooting
everything hunky dory?
keep it
